title: Specifies certain items be included in annual report of housing companies

memo:
BILL NUMBER:S2113

TITLE OF BILL:
An act
to amend the private housing finance law, in relation to annual
reports of limited profit and limited-dividend housing companies

SUMMARY:
This bill would amend Private Housing
Finance Law § 32(2) to
require each Mitchell-Lama housing company to annually provide the
Commissioner of Housing or the appropriate supervising agency its tax
exemption levels and the date any tax abatement or exemption is
scheduled to expire. It would also amend Section 32-b of the Private
Housing and Community Renewal to include information on tax
abatements and tax exemptions granted by localities to Mitchell-Lama
projects in DHCR's Annual Report to the Legislature on the
Mitchell-Lama Program. This bill would also mandate that DHCR's
report specify the date which any tax abatement or exemption is
scheduled to expire.

JUSTIFICATION:
Article 2 of the Private Housing
Finance Law allows
localities to provide tax relief to Mitchell-Lama projects within
their jurisdiction. Private Housing Finance Law Section 33 limits
such relief to a maximum of thirty years. Given this lack of
permanence of the tax relief, many residents and project managers are
unaware that tax reductions granted by localities many years ago may
be about to end. The Division of Housing and Community Renewal is
currently required to submit a comprehensive report on the
implementation of the Mitchell-Lama Program to the Legislature prior
to July 1st of each year. This report is required to include
information on rent and carrying charge levels, total capital outlay,
amortization, mortgage interest rates, surcharge billings use of
surcharge revenues and vacancy rates. By requiring this report to
also include the projected expiration date of any tax exemption on
abatement, this bill would put residents of Mitchell-Lama projects
and project managers on notice and permit them to adequately prepare
for the impending rise in tax liability. Moreover, current law
requires municipalities and supervising agencies to furnish data
requested by the Commissioner for inclusion in this report within
60 days of this request. Accordingly, the inclusion of tax relief
expiration dates should not.place any administrative burden on the
Division.

FISCAL IMPLICATION:
None.

EFFECTIVE DATE:

This act shall take effect on the
thirtieth day after
it shall have become a law.
